title: Android 13 adds native support for flashlight brightness, here’s how it works [Video]
content:
For years now, iPhones and even Samsung’s Android smartphones have supported the ability to adjust the brightness of the LED flashlight on the back of your phone. Now, in Android 13, Google is finally delivering this ability to adjust flashlight brightness natively, and we’ve been able to try it out.

more…

The post Android 13 adds native support for flashlight brightness, here’s how it works [Video] appeared first on 9to5Google.
description: Years after Samsung and Apple introduced the feature, Google is finally adding native support for flashlight brightness to Android 13.
